title: Jumping Jacks
steps: Stand upright with feet together and arms at your sides
Jump while spreading your legs shoulder-width apart
Simultaneously raise your arms above your head
Jump again to return to starting position
Maintain a steady rhythm and controlled breathing
safetyTips: Land softly on the balls of your feet to reduce impact
Keep knees slightly bent during landing
Avoid locking your elbows when arms are raised
recommendation: Great warm-up exercise. Perform 3 sets with 30 seconds rest between sets.

title: Plank
steps: Start in push-up position with hands directly under shoulders
Lower onto your forearms, keeping elbows aligned below shoulders
Form a straight line from head to heels
Engage core muscles by pulling belly button toward spine
Hold position while maintaining normal breathing
safetyTips: Avoid sagging hips or raising buttocks too high
Keep neck neutral by looking at floor slightly ahead of hands
Stop immediately if you feel lower back pain
Modify by dropping knees if needed
recommendation: Start with 30 second holds, gradually increasing to 2 minutes as strength improves.

title: Bodyweight Squats
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out
Extend arms straight out for balance
Initiate movement by pushing hips back as if sitting in a chair
Lower until thighs are parallel to floor (or as low as comfortable)
Keep knees aligned with toes, chest lifted
Press through heels to return to standing
safetyTips: Never let knees cave inward during movement
Maintain weight in heels, not toes
Keep spine neutral - avoid rounding back
Go only as low as you can maintain proper form
recommendation: Perfect for building leg strength. Perform 3 times weekly with at least one rest day between sessions.

title: Bicep Curls
steps: Stand tall with dumbbells in hands, palms facing forward
Keep elbows close to torso and shoulders relaxed
Curl weights upward while contracting biceps
Bring dumbbells to shoulder level without swinging
Slowly lower back to starting position with control
safetyTips: Avoid using momentum to lift weights
Keep wrists straight - don't bend them backward
Maintain slight bend in knees to protect lower back
Don't fully lock elbows at bottom position
recommendation: Use challenging but controllable weight. Rest 60 seconds between sets.

title: Tricep Dips
steps: Position hands on parallel bars or bench edge, fingers forward
Extend legs straight out or bend knees (easier variation)
Lower body by bending elbows to 90 degrees
Keep elbows pointing backward, not flaring outward
Press back up to starting position using triceps
safetyTips: Don't sink shoulders up toward ears
Avoid going too low if you feel shoulder strain
Keep movement controlled - no bouncing at bottom
Engage core to prevent excessive forward lean
recommendation: Excellent for arm strength. Perform 2-3 times weekly with proper rest.

title: Downward Facing
steps: Start on hands and knees (tabletop position)
Tuck toes and lift hips toward ceiling
Straighten legs as much as comfortable
Press hands firmly into mat, spreading fingers wide
Relax head between arms, ears in line with upper arms
Engage core and try to bring heels toward floor
safetyTips: Don't lock knees - maintain micro bend
If hamstrings are tight, keep knees slightly bent
Avoid rounding shoulders - keep them engaged
Modify by placing hands on elevated surface if needed
recommendation: Hold for 5-10 breaths. Great for full-body stretch and strength.

title: Hanging Leg Raises
steps: Hang from pull-up bar with overhand grip
Engage core and lift legs straight up to 90 degrees
Keep movement controlled - avoid swinging
Pause briefly at top, squeezing abs
Slowly lower legs back down with control
safetyTips: Avoid using momentum to lift legs
Start with bent knees if straight legs are too challenging
Stop if you feel strain in shoulders or lower back
recommendation: Advanced core exercise. Build up to 3 sets of 12 reps with perfect form.

title: Push Ups
steps: Start in plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulders
Keep body straight from head to heels
Lower chest toward floor by bending elbows
Stop when elbows reach 90 degrees
Press back up to starting position
safetyTips: Don't let hips sag or rise too high
Keep neck neutral - don't crane head forward
Modify by dropping to knees if needed
recommendation: Fundamental upper body exercise. Perform 3-4 times weekly.

title: Hamstring Stretch
steps: Sit on floor with legs extended straight in front
Keep spine tall and reach forward from hips
Reach toward toes without rounding back
Hold stretch at comfortable intensity
Breathe deeply and relax into stretch
safetyTips: Stretch only to point of mild tension, not pain
Keep knees slightly bent if hamstrings are tight
Maintain long spine - don't hunch forward
recommendation: Perform daily, especially after leg workouts. Hold each side for 30 seconds.

title: Breathing
steps: Lie on back with knees bent or sit comfortably
Place one hand on chest, one on belly
Inhale deeply through nose, filling belly with air
Feel hand on belly rise while chest remains still
Exhale slowly through pursed lips
Focus on slow, controlled breathing rhythm
safetyTips: Don't force breath beyond comfortable capacity
If dizzy, return to normal breathing
Keep shoulders relaxed - don't tense them
Practice in quiet environment for best results
recommendation: Excellent for stress reduction. Practice daily, ideally morning and evening.

title: Burpees
steps: Start standing with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down and place hands on floor
Jump feet back into plank position
Perform push-up (optional for advanced)
Jump feet back toward hands
Explode upward into jump with arms overhead
safetyTips: Land softly with knees slightly bent
Maintain proper push-up form if including
Modify by stepping back instead of jumping
Stop if form deteriorates due to fatigue
recommendation: Full-body conditioning exercise. Rest 60-90 seconds between sets.

title: Russian Twists
steps: Sit on floor with knees bent and heels on ground
Lean back slightly to engage core
Hold weight or medicine ball with both hands
Rotate torso to touch weight to floor beside hip
Return to center and rotate to opposite side
safetyTips: Move slowly with control - no jerking
Keep back straight - don't hunch shoulders
For easier version, keep feet on floor
recommendation: Great for oblique strength. Perform 3 times weekly.

title: Walking Lunges
steps: Stand tall with feet together
Step forward with right leg, lowering hips
Descend until both knees form 90-degree angles
Keep front knee aligned with ankle
Push through front heel to return to standing
Immediately step forward with left leg to repeat
safetyTips: Don't let front knee extend past toes
Keep torso upright - don't lean forward
Start without weights to master form
recommendation: Excellent for leg strength and balance. Perform 2-3 times weekly.

title: Hammer Curls
steps: Stand holding dumbbells with neutral grip (palms facing in)
Keep elbows close to sides, shoulders relaxed
Curl weights upward while maintaining neutral grip
Squeeze biceps at top of movement
Slowly lower back to starting position
safetyTips: Avoid swinging weights - use controlled motion
Don't arch back to lift heavier weights
Exhale while lifting, inhale while lowering
recommendation: Targets biceps and forearms. Rest 60 seconds between sets.

title: Tricep Kickbacks
steps: Hold dumbbell in right hand, bend forward at hips
Place left hand on bench for support
Keep upper arm parallel to floor, elbow bent at 90 degrees
Extend arm straight back, contracting triceps
Hold briefly at full extension
Slowly return to starting position
safetyTips: Keep back flat - don't round shoulders
Only lower arm moves - upper arm stays fixed
Use appropriate weight to maintain form
Avoid locking elbow at full extension
recommendation: Great isolation exercise. Perform with controlled movement.

title: Warrior II Pose
steps: Stand with feet wide apart (about 4 feet)
Turn right foot out 90 degrees, left foot slightly in
Bend right knee until thigh is parallel to floor
Extend arms parallel to floor at shoulder height
Gaze over right fingertips
Keep torso centered between hips
safetyTips: Keep bent knee aligned over ankle
Engage core to protect lower back
recommendation: Builds strength and balance. Practice both sides equally.

title: Bicycle Crunches
steps: Lie on back with hands behind head, elbows wide
Lift shoulders off mat and bring knees to tabletop
Extend right leg while rotating left elbow to right knee
Switch sides in pedaling motion
Keep lower back pressed into mat
Maintain slow, controlled movement
safetyTips: Don't pull on neck with hands
Exhale as you twist, inhale as you switch
recommendation: Effective for obliques. Perform 3-4 times weekly.

title: Mountain Climbers
steps: Start in plank position
Drive right knee toward chest
Quickly switch legs, bringing left knee in
Maintain steady pace and flat back
safetyTips: Land softly on balls of feet
recommendation: Great for cardio endurance. Maintain controlled movement throughout.

title: Glute Bridge
steps: Lie on back with knees bent
Lift hips until body forms straight line
Squeeze glutes at top
Lower slowly
recommendation: Excellent for glute activation. Hold top position for 2 seconds.

title: Superman Hold
steps: Lie face down with arms extended
Lift arms and legs simultaneously
Hold position
recommendation: Strengthens lower back. Start with shorter holds and progress.

title: Wall Sit
steps: Lean against wall with knees at 90°
Keep back flat against wall
Hold position
safetyTips: Don't let knees extend past toes
recommendation: Builds quad endurance. Increase time gradually.

title: Calf Raises
steps: Stand on edge of step
Raise onto toes
Lower heels below step level
recommendation: Do both straight-leg and bent-knee variations for complete calf development.

title: Bird Dog
steps: On hands and knees
Extend opposite arm/leg
Keep hips level
recommendation: Excellent for core stability. Hold each extension for 2-3 seconds.

title: Side Plank
steps: Prop up on one forearm
Stack feet
Lift hips
recommendation: Builds oblique strength. Progress to lifting top leg for added challenge.

title: Inchworm
steps: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Bend forward and walk hands out to plank
Hold plank for 1 second
Walk hands back to feet
safetyTips: Maintain slight bend in knees if hamstrings are tight
recommendation: Great dynamic warm-up. Focus on controlled movement.

title: Dead Bug
steps: Lie on back with arms extended toward ceiling
Bring knees to tabletop position
Slowly extend opposite arm/leg
Return to start
safetyTips: Maintain lower back contact with floor
recommendation: Excellent for core coordination. Exhale during extension.

title: Step Ups
steps: Stand facing bench or step
Step up with right foot
Bring left knee up
Step down with control
safetyTips: Use step height that keeps knee at 90°
recommendation: Focus on controlled lowering phase. Add weight for progression.

title: Reverse Crunches
steps: Lie on back with knees bent
Lift knees toward chest
Roll pelvis off floor
Lower with control
safetyTips: Keep lower back pressed to floor
recommendation: Focus on slow, controlled movement. Exhale during lift.

title: Side-Lying Leg Raises
steps: Lie on side with legs stacked
Lift top leg toward ceiling
Lower with control
recommendation: Targets hip abductors. Keep toes pointed forward.

title: Flutter Kicks
steps: Lie on back with legs extended
Lift heels 6 inches off floor
Alternate small up/down kicks
recommendation: Engages lower abs. Start with shorter durations.

title: Wall Push Ups
steps: Stand facing wall
Place hands on wall at chest height
Bend elbows to bring chest toward wall
Push back to start
recommendation: Good introductory push-up variation. Progress to incline push-ups.

title: Seated Shoulder Press
steps: Sit on bench with back support
Hold dumbbells at shoulder height
Press upward until arms are straight
Lower with control
recommendation: Start with light weights to perfect form before progressing.

title: Standing Calf Stretch
steps: Stand facing wall
Step one foot back
Keep back leg straight
Lean into wall until stretch is felt
recommendation: Do after calf exercises or running. Bend back knee to stretch soleus.

title: Shoulder Circles
steps: On hands and knees
Make small circles with shoulders
Alternate directions
recommendation: Great for shoulder mobility. Do before upper body workouts.

title: Seated Spinal Twist
steps: Sit with legs extended
Bend right knee and cross over left leg
Twist torso to right
Use left arm to deepen stretch
recommendation: Improves spinal mobility. Breathe deeply into the stretch.

title: Scapular Push Ups
steps: Start in plank position
Protract and retract shoulder blades
Keep arms straight
recommendation: Excellent for shoulder health. Focus on scapular movement.

title: Lying Leg Circles
steps: Lie on back with one leg extended up
Make small circles with raised leg
Alternate directions
recommendation: Works hip flexors and core. Keep circles small at first.

title: Oblique Crunches
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Place hands behind head
Bend sideways at waist
Return to center
recommendation: Good alternative to floor oblique exercises. Engage core throughout.

title: Ankle Circles
steps: Sit or stand on one leg
Rotate other ankle in circles
Alternate directions
recommendation: Do before lower body workouts or running. Helps prevent ankle injuries.

title: Leg Extensions
steps: Sit tall on chair
Extend one leg straight
Flex foot
Lower with control
recommendation: Good for quad strength. Add ankle weights for progression.

title: Standing Hip Circles
steps: Stand with hands on hips
Make circles with hips
Alternate directions
recommendation: Great warm-up for lower body workouts. Increases hip mobility.

title: Chair Dips
steps: Sit on edge of chair with hands gripping edge
Slide butt off chair
Lower body by bending elbows
Push back up
recommendation: Beginner-friendly triceps exercise. Keep movement controlled.

title: Hamstring Curl
steps: Stand holding chair for balance
Bend one knee to bring heel toward glutes
Slowly lower
recommendation: Targets hamstrings. Add ankle weights for progression.

title: Seated March
steps: Sit tall on chair
Alternate lifting knees
Pump arms
recommendation: Good seated cardio option. Increase speed gradually.

title: Wall Angels
steps: Stand with back against wall
Bend elbows to 90° with arms against wall
Slide arms up and down
recommendation: Improves shoulder mobility and posture. Do daily if possible.

title: Neck Stretch
steps: Gently tilt head to one side
Use hand to deepen stretch
Switch sides
recommendation: Relieves neck tension. Breathe deeply during stretch.

title: Quad Stretch
steps: Stand holding chair for balance
Bend one knee to bring heel toward glutes
Hold ankle
Keep knees together
recommendation: Essential after quad-focused exercises. Modify with towel if needed.

title: Seated Toe Taps
steps: Sit tall on chair
Alternate tapping toes quickly
Keep heels on floor
recommendation: Low-impact cardio option. Increase speed as able.

title: Shoulder Rolls
steps: Stand or sit tall
Roll shoulders backward in circles
Alternate directions
recommendation: Relieves shoulder tension. Do throughout the day.

title: Seated Knee Lifts
steps: Sit tall
Lift your knees towards chest
Lower with control
recommendation: Beginner-friendly core exercise. Exhale when lifting knee.
